data.title: Great Food and Great Environment
data.text: Ate here for the first time last night with some friends and was very pleased. The beer selection is awesome, the food was delicious, and the service was great. We had humus and fried pickles to start (both were yummy). I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was so fresh and really tasty. Had a side of gouda mac and cheese which was incredible. Highly recommend it. Overall a great experience and would definitely eat here again!

data.title: Great beer selection ok food
data.text: Ate here one evening on a Saturday. The atmosphere is fun and laid back and their beer selection is massive. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about their beers and made some good suggestions. I ordered their pimento cheese sandwich  the bread was over toasted and do the sandwich was stiff and hard to eat. I did not like the pimento cheese as it was made from sharp cheddar and this was an overpowering flavor, but if you like sharp cheddar you would like theirs. My husband ordered their sausage trio and enjoyed it. Our son got the shrimp and grits which he enjoyed and could not eat all. His wife got their salad with chicken. It was very large and lots of chicken. We would go back as it is a very fun place to sit and enjoy the beer and conversation

data.title: Hipster Haven
data.text: Huge bar menu, including beer brewed on site. Not a great menu for picky eaters, unless you want a burger. Ordered the avocado chicken salad sandwich, which had maybe two tablespoons of chicken and no discernible avocado. Very loud, with a younger crowd at the bar. Probably a good place for drinks and apps with friends,not for a dinner for two.

data.title: Great local place
data.text: Very casual, comfortable and cool brew pub. The beer selection is excellent and ever changing. The food is generous and tasty.

data.title: Great outdoor deck!
data.text: We have visited Hop Alley several times. The food is always good and the extensive beers are always cold. We especially enjoy the out door deck when the weather is nice. They are also one of the few restaurants/bars in the area to have their own parking lot behind the building.  The only thing missing are a few tv's.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Fabulous food.  Our favorite appetizers were the fried cheese curds with beer cheese dipping sauce and the jar of bacon with whipped honey vanilla peanut butter.  They are soooooo delicious!  Ate out on the back deck since the weather was nice.  An enjoyable evening.

data.title: Loved the apps, the beer and the atmosphere!
data.text: We sat at the bar for a drink before a concert.  The beer was fantastic and the appetizer was delicious!  Friendly bar tender and relaxed atmosphere!  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Come for the beer, stay for the food
data.text: I have been here three or four times, and never been disappointed. I am a beer enthusiast and love their offerings. Their food is delicious and enjoyable, not gourmet but still better than what you typically get at a bar. Great for a singleton, a group or a family.

data.title: Funky, fun brew pub in growing DT Alpharetta!
data.text: Really fun place and great vibe - with the additional seating out back, there's plenty of room to enjoy a cold one on tap!

data.title: Tasty food, great service, great location
data.text: We have eaten here several times with friends.  They have lots of different beers and flavored vodkas that they make in-house.  The wait staff has always been wonderful - friendly and professional.  The food quality is also very good.  Try this place out.

data.title: Nice spot for a bite & beverage.
data.text: Our family were in the neighborhood and stopped in for dinner on a Saturday evening.  Staff were very pleasant, local brews were refreshing and the food was very good. We had a build your own Burger, Avocado chicken salad, & a Rueben with a variety of sides that we shared.  I will definitely stop again the next time we are in the area.

data.title: Typical bar food
data.text: Busy place, fair service, typical bar food.  Not a beer drinker so it was probably not the best place for me.

data.title: Beer & Great Food
data.text: The service was great, food was great, and drinks were on point. Great beer selection. Within walking distance of my house, but after a few drinks short Uber ride.. lol.. Will be going back again soon!

data.title: Decent, but overpriced and the servers are not friendly
data.text: The food was sort of sub-par bar food that took too long to come out and was overpriced, although it's location to downtown makes it convenient for the people who live there.. Overall, the atmosphere was loud and chaotic, not a family place for sure. The beer was decent, nothing to shout home about.

data.title: Horrible service and mediocre food
data.text: Went for the first time on July 4- what a disaster. After an hour and a half with no food, the waiter reluctantly admitted that the kitchen was short staffed. He could not provide an estimate of when our food would be ready. This establishment is clueless about customer service. Knowing that they could not prepare the orders in a timely manner, management should have disclosed the problem prior to our being seated. If that had been done, customers could decide if they would rather have a very slow meal or go elsewhere. Once the food did arrive, it was not good. We asked for an adjustment to the bill and they did remove the food charge. However, that did not compensate for such an unpleasant experience. None of the three couples, who are all Alpharetta residents and regular restaurant patrons, will be back.

data.title: Great Burgers and Brews in Downtown Alpharetta
data.text: I eat here for lunch on a regular basis as it is close to my office. They have a great selection of craft beer, some really interesting choices if you want to try something different. The food is very good, they have great burgers and you have to try the huge onion rings and the cheese curds! The service is always good and the staff really knows their beer selection. They are a micro brewery so you get to see the beer being made right there in the restaurant and sample some great local selections. Overall a great relaxed place to visit.

data.title: Peanut Butter Bacon
data.text: Fun after work happy hour spot. We ordered all of the appetizers but and they threw in a few that weren't on the menu (deep fried smoked sausage). They were all yummy, however, the peanut butter bacon was the very best!!!!

data.title: Fun place!
data.text: We love the grass fed meats! Such a fun place to eat and gather with friends! Micro brews, burgers, downtown Alpharetta. All good!

data.title: Love This Place
data.text: Great beer. Great service. Great food (especially the poutine)! We drive an hour to come here and it's worth it every time.

data.title: good brews, decent food
data.text:
An old coworker and I wanted to catch up on a Friday night. So we decided upon this place. We met at around 9:15 PM. The place had quite a few openings for a Friday night. We sat at the bar - the waitress was great, attentive and knew how to hold a conversation. Good service. 

I tried a couple of their beers and it was fresh, clean crisp drafts. I had the pimento cheese sandwich with sweet potato fries..which was good and my buddy had the fish taco...the food is good but the options for vegetarians is limited.

Also they close around 11 so by around 10:30 PM they started wrapping up, Kinda early for a Friday night.
